name: Airtel SIM Deactivation eKYC Scam
description: Scammer impersonates Airtel claiming the victim's SIM card will be deactivated due to incomplete eKYC, threatening loss of UPI and bank OTP services, then extracts payment via fake UPI ID.

turns.scammer_message: Airtel Alert: Your SIM card will be deactivated within 24 hours due to incomplete eKYC verification. All services including UPI and bank OTP will stop. Verify now.
turns.notes: Initial scare message impersonating Airtel with SIM deactivation and UPI/OTP disruption threat.

turns.scammer_message: Dear Airtel customer, your SIM eKYC is pending as per TRAI regulations. To complete verification and prevent deactivation, please call our Airtel eKYC helpline at +91-9922001133. Our executive will verify your Aadhaar details over the phone.
turns.notes: Scammer provides fake helpline number to collect Aadhaar and personal details.

turns.scammer_message: eKYC verification requires a one-time processing fee of Rs 35. Please pay to our official Airtel eKYC UPI: airtel.ekyc@paytm â€” After payment, your eKYC will be marked complete and SIM will remain active. This is mandatory for all prepaid and postpaid users.
turns.notes: Scammer reveals UPI ID and demands small processing fee for fake eKYC.

turns.scammer_message: LAST CHANCE: Your Airtel SIM will be deactivated in 3 hours. You will lose access to all OTPs, UPI transactions, and bank verifications. Pay Rs 35 eKYC fee to airtel.ekyc@paytm or call +91-9922001133 RIGHT NOW. After deactivation, reactivation will cost Rs 500.
turns.notes: Final urgency repeating UPI and phone with deactivation countdown and higher reactivation cost.
